snippet: The state-sponsored tax-free accounts allow disabled people to accumulate savings without jeopardizing eligibility for need-based government help.
abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column notes disabled people will be able to open tax-free savings accounts under at least two programs offered nationally in summer 2016; remarks that state-sponsored accounts will allow disabled people to save without jeopardizing eligibility for need-based government aid; questions and answers on accounts offered.
lead_paragraph: The state-sponsored tax-free accounts allow disabled people to accumulate savings without jeopardizing eligibility for need-based government help.

headline.print_headline: Accounts Let Disabled Save Without Risk to Government Aid
headline.main: 529A Accounts Let Disabled Save Without Risk to Government Aid
